title: Member Lecture: Life and Afterlife in Ancient Egypt
title_display: Member Lecture: Life and Afterlife in Ancient Egypt
hero_caption: Model of a River Boat, Middle Kingdom, Dynasty 11–12, about 2046–1794 BCE. Ancient Egyptian. Gift of Henry H. Getty, Charles L. Hutchinson, Robert H. Fleming, and Norman W. Harris.
short_description: Join us in person and hear from Ashley Arico, assistant curator of ancient Egyptian Art, on the occasion of Life and Afterlife in Ancient Egypt, the Art Institute's new permanent installation of ancient Egyptian works.
list_description: Hear from curator Ashley Arico on the occasion of Life and Afterlife in Ancient Egypt, the Art Institute's new permanent installation of ancient Egyptian works.
description:
Join us in person and hear from Ashley Arico, assistant curator of ancient Egyptian Art, on the occasion of Life and Afterlife in Ancient Egypt, the Art Institute's new permanent installation of ancient Egyptian works. She will share how objects in the museum's collection figured into ancient Egyptian life and practices related to death and the afterlife.

Please note that this is an in-person event that takes place at the museum.

All visitors ages 5 and up are required to show proof of vaccination. Proof can include a physical vaccine card, a photocopy of the card, a digital record or app on your phone, or a printed record from a vaccine provider. Those 16 and over must also show a photo ID.

If you have any questions about programming, please reach out to museum-programs@artic.edu.

For questions related to accessibility accommodations, please email access@artic.edu.
